fullName: /api/roles GET /roles When asked for existing roles, Then should retrieve and receive 200 response along with existing fields
/api/roles When asked for existing roles, Then should retrieve them and receive 200 response
When asked for one specific role by id, Then should retrieve it and receive 200 response
When asked for a non-existent role by id, Then should retrieve error and receive 404 response
When asked for a role by non-valid number id, Then should retrieve error and receive 400 response
When role retrieval fails, then it should return status 404
When asked for a role by string instead of number as id, Then should retrieve error and receive 400 response
When error is thrown in get all roles, Then should pass the error to the next function
When error is thrown in get one role, Then should pass the error to the next function
/api/roles GET /users When asked for existing users, Then should retrieve and receive 200 response along with existing fields
/api/roles When asked for existing users, Then should retrieve them and receive 200 response
When asked for one specific user by id, Then should retrieve it and receive 200 response
When asked for a non-existent user by id, Then should retrieve error and receive 404 response
When asked for a user by non-valid number id, Then should retrieve error and receive 400 response
When user retrieval fails, then it should return status 404
When asked for a user by string instead of number as id, Then should retrieve error and receive 400 response
When error is thrown in get all users, Then should pass the error to the next function
When error is thrown in get one user, Then should pass the error to the next function
/api POST /roles When asked to save a new role, Then it saves it and returns the newly created user
/api POST /roles When asked to save a new role with already existing username, Then it returns an error with status 409
/api POST /roles When role creation fails, then it should return status 404
/api POST /users When asked to save a new user, Then it saves it and returns the newly created user
/api POST /users When asked to save a new user with already existing username, Then it returns an error with status 409
/api POST /users When asked to save a new user with already existing email, Then it returns an error with status 409
/api POST /users When user creation fails, then it should return status 404
